extendedInfo.description: The first ever photo sharing site for Twitter comes to Android! Twitpic is the easiest and best way to share your photos and videos with your Twitter followers. â Quickly and seamlessly share your photos and videos with all of your Twitter followers â Edit your photos with beautiful filters and easy to use enhancement tools â Browse your Twitter photo timeline with photos from people you follow in a beautiful interface â Browse photos from the most popular Twitpic users â Manage your Twitpic photos and videos in your own timeline

reviews.title: Excellent app.
reviews.comment: Very similar filter idea to Instagram but with better controls.   Very impressive.   Highly recommended.   S3 running Jellybean 4.1.2
reviews.author: Wiggysan Wiggysan

reviews.title: support! and need development application
reviews.comment: hey users, this is still the first version x)) understand? that still need development, keep support twitpic Twitpic is The first ever photo sharing site
reviews.author: tio badd

reviews.title: Not so good - on a Samsung Galaxy S2
reviews.comment: TwitPic - it worked once but it will not work again - I can\'t see the \"click photo\" button
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Bad
reviews.comment: Its a very new app.. why doesn\'t it have a menu button in the same app!!! All new phones after GNexus and Ice cream sandwich (and now JB) won\'t have a physical menu button!! Menu buttons MUST be in the app itself or else it\'ll look so outdated. + screen size doesn\'t fit with GNexus!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Hasn\'t worked in weeks (XperiaT)
reviews.comment: Worked great for a while but stopped working all of a sudden.  Won\'t upload pics or post to Twitter anymore. When trying to upload it says username is @null and then hangs with a \"loading\" message
reviews.author: Ashley Cahill

reviews.title: Will probably uninstall
reviews.comment: This app literally does nothing. Description says you can manage your photos..but you can\'t do anything! Needs the option to delete pictures. HTC Evo 3D
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sharing is not easy
reviews.comment: Installed the app a few min ago, uploaded a pic and (a) can\'t share with Facebook, (b) can\'t find the picture\'s URL, (c) profile/menu settings seem to be missing.
reviews.author: Jose Ramon Perez Fernandez

reviews.title: Low graphics
reviews.comment: App has low graphics when you see the menus. It has few options. Its not really that good as Instagram. I like Twitpic, I\'ve been using it since I started Twitter, but I need this App to be better. Please modify it and update everything for this App. Graphic, options, settings must be updated!
reviews.author: Art Keddesh Rombaoa

reviews.title: Unresponsive.
reviews.comment: \"Unfortunately,  twitpic has stopped\" tells me that everytime I upload a pic. And it does not apply the effects.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Clumsy.
reviews.comment: What, no LANDSCAPE mode? At least not for my tablet, it seems.
reviews.author: John Martens

reviews.comment: Keeps telling me that I need to keep logging in and my pics don\'t post. Its been almost a whole month since i was last able to use it
reviews.author: James Montoya

reviews.title: Used it once
reviews.comment: Now it just opens as a blank screen, can\'t do anything with it even after two restarts and a reinstall. HTC Rezound.
reviews.author: Ben Pearman

reviews.title: Not the \"Ish\"
reviews.comment: Needs to be upgraded. Hard to use, not easy to control things such as profile picture  Menu key doesn\'t work for shortcuts. Overall: waste of memory space. :p
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: What\'s the point
reviews.comment: This app is beyond pointless. From the description I thought you can upload pix and share them on Twitter, Facebook etc. This app is just a waste of space.
reviews.author: Shon Neely

reviews.title: Samsung galaxy mini problems
reviews.comment: I don\'t even know how to.get the thing started?? Anyone help me??
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Horrible app
reviews.comment: Once I downloaded the app I couldn\'t view pictures on Twitter anymore. I had to go to the Twitpic app itself to view anything. And the app is terribly UN- user friendly. It\'s a shame too because on the actual website Twitpic is great.  As an Android application- it sucks balls.
reviews.author: Jay Poore

reviews.title: I was waiting for this!
reviews.comment: I\'ve been using TwitPic for all my photo-tweeting so this is great they finally have an app! And twice as great since they\'ve used the awesome Aviary tools for photo editing. My only issue is that I already have Aviary installed on my phone that\'s a more recent version with some features I really like AND the additional effects filters (that I paid for). So I wish TwitPic would recognize when Aviary was already installed and use that instead of it\'s own.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Slow.
reviews.comment: The app is very slow. Uploads sometimes fail without any reason. The developers haven\'t made any attempt at all to follow Android design guidelines.
reviews.author: Matthew Gamble

reviews.title: Needs Serious Update
reviews.comment: Samsung Ice Cream system update allows app to finally log in a use. I use it 3 times since the update.  After 3 times the app stopped working.  Need bug fixes and overall update.  This app has not been update since late 2012.  I don\'t have a instagram & this app is the only app that allows you to upload photos & videos.  Please make an update.  Thanks
reviews.author: Rod Gore

reviews.title: Luke-warm on it at the moment.
reviews.comment: Installed twitpic and connected it to my twitter. First pic went through like a charm. Went away from that app then returned a few minutes later and twitpic didn\'t remember who i was...i apparently became @null in the interim. I tried posting as @null and the pic did go to my twitpic page, but didn\'t post to my twitter.  All in all I think it could be a nice app when the bugs ate gone. Its a bit frustrating to have to log out then in to be sure its going to work
reviews.author: Michael McPhee
